item.title: Invite Diligent Learning
item.description: Leading inspired discussions results in meaningful participation in the classroom.

item.title: Love Those You Teach
item.description: Loving those you teach goes beyond what happens in the classroom.

item.title: Prepare and Teach by the Spirit
item.description: The best way to teach by the Spirit is to prepare by the Spirit, and that includes daily discipleship.

item.title: Teach the Doctrine
item.description: Teaching the doctrine clearly and powerfully helps build faith in Jesus Christ and bring about true conversion.

item.title: Welcome Teachers
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland gives insight and encouragement to newly called teachers of the Church.

item.title: Introduction to Teacher Council Meetings
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland provides an overview of what teacher council meetings are and why they are important.

item.title: Learn Together
item.description: What does it mean to learn together in a teacher council meeting? Here are some insights.

item.title: Practice And Invite
item.description: What does it mean to practice and invite during a teacher council meeting? Here is one perspective.

item.title: Share And Counsel Together
item.description: What does it mean to share and counsel in a teacher council meeting? Here is one experience.

item.title: Leading in the Savior’s Way
item.description: The Leadership Training Library contains resources for leaders to learn how to lead like the Savior.

item.title: Library Tutorial
item.description: Explore the Leadership Training Library.

item.title: Following the Handbook
item.description: President Monson encourages leaders to consult the handbooks regarding policies and procedures.

item.title: Learn, Teach, and Apply Handbook Principles
item.description: Elder Nelson explains the purpose of the Training Resource Library.

item.title: Teaching Leadership
item.description: Aaronic Priesthood - Teaching Leadership

item.title: Your Responsibility for Quorums
item.description: Members of the ward Young Men presidency act as advisers for quorum presidencies.

item.title: Sacred Keys of the Aaronic Priesthood
item.description: Aaronic Priesthood - Sacred Keys of the Aaronic Priesthood

item.title: The Keys of the Priesthood
item.description: Aaronic Priesthood - The Keys of the Priesthood

item.title: Magnificent Aaronic Priesthood: Part 1
item.description: Aaronic Priesthood - Magnificent Aaronic Priesthood: Part 1

item.title: Magnificent Aaronic Priesthood: Part 2
item.description: Aaronic Priesthood - Magnificent Aaronic Priesthood: Part 2

item.title: Magnificent Aaronic Priesthood: Part 3
item.description: Aaronic Priesthood - Magnificent Aaronic Priesthood: Part 3

item.title: Until We Meet Again
item.description: President Monson expresses appreciation to all members for their service in callings.

item.title: Preparation in the Priesthood
item.description: The Lord will assist and uplift leaders and make their weaknesses their strengths.

item.title: Providing in the Lord's Way
item.description: Priesthood and auxiliary leaders are responsible to coordinate and facilitate welfare assistance.

item.title: The Hearts of the Children Shall Turn
item.description: Priesthood and auxiliary leaders should encourage members to engage in family history work.

item.title: Teaching after the Manner of the Spirit
item.description: Effective gospel teaching helps people grow in their testimonies and faith of Jesus Christ and Heavenly Father.

item.title: Following the Spirit in the Ward Council
item.description: Ward leaders follow the Spirit to receive inspiration to carry out their callings and assignments in ward council.

item.title: New and Returning Member Progress
item.description: Ward council members help strengthen new and returning members in the ward.

item.title: He Shall Prepare a Way
item.description: By following the Spirit, ward council members are inspired to invite less-active members to return to the fold.

item.title: The One
item.description: Members are challenged to express their love to less-active members of the ward and invite them to return to the fold.

item.title: Standing Together in the Work of Salvation
item.description: Ward council members work together to rescue a family.

item.title: To the Rescue
item.description: President Monson explains each member’s duty to preach the gospel.

item.title: On the Lord's Errand
item.description: President Monson tells of the importance of each priest in his priests quorum when he was a young bishop.

item.title: Home Teaching: A Work of Love
item.description: Home teachers help members strengthen their faith and encourage them to keep covenants.

item.title: Organizing Home Teaching
item.description: Reporting home teaching is essential to understanding how to best serve individuals and families.

item.title: Reporting Home Teaching
item.description: Home teaching assignments are organized under the direction of the Priesthood to bless the lives of individuals and families.

item.title: Home Teaching: Encouraging Aaronic Priesthood Holders
item.description: Aaronic Priesthood holders can learn how to home teach from quorum advisers and by participating in home teaching with Melchizedek Priesthood holding partners.

item.title: Responsibilities of Visiting Teachers
item.description: Visiting teachers minister to their sisters as they fulfill the purposes of Relief Society to increase faith, strengthen families, and provide relief.

item.title: Organizing Visiting Teaching
item.description: Relief Society presidencies can organize visiting teaching successfully as they follow Handbook principles.

item.title: Assigning Visiting Teaching
item.description: Relief Society presidencies prayerfully consider visiting teaching assignments. As they receive and follow inspiration, miracles occur.

item.title: Reporting Visiting Teaching
item.description: Handbook 2 allows for visiting teaching reports to be received in a variety of ways. Reports focus on the needs of sisters and service rendered.

item.title: Visiting Teaching in the Work of Salvation
item.description: Visiting teachers can play a powerful role in helping sisters and their families progress toward eternal life.

item.title: A Model Home Teacher
item.description: President Monson describes how to be an effective home teacher.

item.title: Ministering to Spiritual Needs
item.description: Home teachers are charged with the responsibility to care for the spiritual needs of their assigned families.

category.title: Featured Training: Learning and Teaching in the Home and Church
category.subtitle: Videos: 6

item.title: Learning and Teaching in the Home and the Church - The Home
item.description: The home is a sacred place to learn and teach gospel principles. This informal setting allows daily teaching moments and is focused on meeting the needs of individuals and families.

item.title: Learning and Teaching in the Home and the Church - The Church
item.description: Teaching in Church meetings and classes helps individuals and families learn the doctrine and take the principles into their homes. Effective teachers bear testimony and invite action.

item.title: Prepare Spiritually
item.description: Bishops and auxiliary leaders of the Church need to prepare themselves spiritually each day.

item.title: The Spirit of Revelation
item.description: If leaders of the Relief Society prepare themselves spiritually, they will receive guidance to meet the needs of the sisters in the ward.

item.title: Seek, and Ye Shall Find
item.description: Assistant ward mission leaders should seek guidance from the Lord to know how to magnify their calling.

item.title: Teaching About Covenants
item.description: Strengthening a home means making and keeping sacred covenants, and teaching your children to do the same.

item.title: Daily Spiritual Preparation Long
item.description: Dedicating time daily for spiritual preparation will bring peace to our homes and prepare our families to meet life's challenges.

item.title: Family Councils
item.description: Meeting together in our homes to discuss needs, interests, and taking the time to listen to one another will strengthen familial bonds.

item.title: Participating in Councils
item.description: Ward councils are an opportunity for ward leaders to receive revelation.

item.title: Working Together in the Ward Council
item.description: Church leaders meet together in councils to work together and plan how to minister to the ward members’ needs.

item.title: Working Together in Service and Love
item.description: Christ knows how to minister to others perfectly. If we are His hands, should we not do the same?

item.title: Receiving Revelation as a Council
item.description: Councils can be a revelatory experience as we unite to discuss and address specific needs.

item.title: Seeking Revelation to Meet Needs
item.description: Through study, prayer, and planning, the Spirit will guide us in meeting the needs of others.

item.title: Ministering to Meet Needs
item.description: Ministering to others includes finding out their needs and showing Christlike love.

item.title: Minister to Others
item.description: Ministering to the needs of the ward members is the work of love.

item.title: Watching Over the One
item.description: A bishop persists in reactivating a youth in his ward, understanding the love of Jesus Christ for this young man.

item.title: The Errand of Angels
item.description: Relief Society sisters have the divine role of ministering to struggling ward members.

item.title: Ministering to Children (Worldwide Leadership Training)
item.description: The Primary presidency is to become familiar with children, strengthen children individually, and help children participate in Primary.

item.title: Training Future Leaders
item.description: See beyond the reality of a person to the possibilities that lie inside them.

item.title: The Power of Invitation
item.description: As we put our faith in the Lord, he will help us find those ready to accept the gospel.

item.title: Teach the Gospel
item.description: Elders quorum presidents and high priests group leaders are responsible for the gospel learning in their quorums and groups.

item.title: Principles of Teaching
item.description: Principles of Teaching

item.title: Serving in the Bishopric
item.description: The Church gives an explanation of the five basic duties of bishops as well as testimonies of real bishops.

item.title: A Faithful Disciple
item.description: Bishops need to prepare themselves spiritually each day.

item.title: Purposes of Sacrament Meeting
item.description: Sacrament meetings are the most sacred meetings in the Church, allowing members to renew covenants made at baptism.

item.title: Preparing Young Men for Missions
item.description: Bishops have a responsibility to prepare worthy, qualified members to serve as missionaries.

item.description: Bishops are responsible for administering and overseeing welfare assistance in the ward.

item.description: President Monson discusses the roles, attributes, and impact of effective bishops.

item.description: President Monson tells of the importance of each priest in his priests quorum when he was a young bishop.
